name: Webwrap
tagline: A small extension of Twitter Bootstrap to convert your site to Flat UI without any functional interference.
body:
Introduction

Webwrap is small open source (just 3.2 kilobytes) Bootstrap extension for implementing Flat UI using Twitter Bootstrap. Web designers at Web Bakerz felt the need of a code snippet which could convert a website based on Twitter Bootstrap directly to flat UI without changing or interfering with the functionality of the site. Hence giving rise to the birth of Webwrap.

Table Of Contents

Version 1.0 of Webwrap has following contents

  • Getting Started
  • Latest Updates
  • Screenshots
  • Bugs and feature requests
  • Creator
  • License

Getting Started

Webwrap is easy to go snippet of code. You just need to follow the steps below:

  1. Download Webwrap
  2. Just include webwrap.min.css after bootstrap.min.css
    or, you can copy and paste the below piece of code in your project.
    <link href="css/bootstrap.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
    <link href="css/webwrap.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

Latest Updates

  • Support for transparent Navbar has been added. Now you can make your navbar transparent by adding the class .nav-transparent to <nav> tag of the navbar.

Bugs and feature requests

Have a bug or a feature request? Please first search for existing and closed issues. If your problem or idea is not addressed yet, please open a new issue.

Creator

Sidharth Malhotra
